emails.subject: Re: dashboard freight matrix

emails.body_text:
If we filter on Panama, so all the items are Neo Panama, so you're right neo Panama = Panama canal.

________________________________

From: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>
Sent: 02 December 2025 19:25
To: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: dashboard freight matrix 
 
Thanks, that works. Fgos, neo panama means the Panama Canal, right? And would include panama canal fees?


________________________________

From: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>
Sent: Tuesday, December 2, 2025 11:07 AM
To: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>; Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: dashboard freight matrix 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

Hello Jennie,
I’ve prepared the data for you.
Could you please check it and let me know if you need anything else?
Thanks,
Mohamed Jebrane Ben Salem

Head of Tunisia office

                                                                                                   jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io <mailto:jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>  

+216 29 715 739



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

    info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | Tel. +41 22 732 53 72 | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/> 

 

 

________________________________

From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Sent: 02 December 2025 18:22
To: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: dashboard freight matrix
 

Hi Jennie,

 

Thanks for flagging this.

 

For the comparison issue, we’ll check internally with the team to see if we can enable viewing both routes on the same chart.

 

Regarding the download problem: when exporting, please choose Summarized Data, then change the default export option from

“xlsx (Excel) with live connection  500,000 row max”

to

“xlsx (Excel) with live connection  150,000 row max.”

 



 

Using that second option should allow all data points in the chart to download correctly.

 

Please let me know if you still encounter any difficulties with downloading the data.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/> 

 

 

From: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>
Sent: Tuesday, December 2, 2025 17:37
To: Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: dashboard freight matrix

 

Hi,

 

I wanted to look at soybean freight from USG to China via cape vs panama canal. The matrix chart won't let me select two to see on the same graph together, so I tried to download both to put them together on one chart myself. But when I download, it only gives me 1 point of data (I tried both export as underlying data and summarized data and they both only give one point). When I open excel it looks like the second snapshot. 

Unless it's an immediate fix, can you go and send me the data first please?

 

       

 

 



 

 

Thanks,

Jennie

 

 

 



Jennie Campbell

Viserion Management Company

914-860-5692
emails.body_html:
If we filter on Panama, so all the items are Neo Panama, so you're right neo Panama = Panama canal.
From: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>
Sent: 02 December 2025 19:25
To: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: dashboard freight matrix
 
Thanks, that works. Fgos, neo panama means the Panama Canal, right? And would include panama canal fees?

Sent: Tuesday, December 2, 2025 11:07 AM
To: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>; Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: dashboard freight matrix

Mohamed Jebrane Ben Salem

Head of Tunisia office

                                                                                                   jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io

From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Sent: 02 December 2025 18:22
To: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: dashboard freight matrix
 

Hi Jennie,

 

Thanks for flagging this.

 

For the comparison issue, we’ll check internally with the team to see if we can enable viewing both routes on the same chart.

 

Regarding the download problem: when exporting, please choose Summarized Data, then change the default export option from

“xlsx (Excel) with live connection  500,000 row max”

to

“xlsx (Excel) with live connection  150,000 row max.”

 

 

Using that second option should allow all data points in the chart to download correctly.

 

Please let me know if you still encounter any difficulties with downloading the data.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io

 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io | www.dnext.io

 

 

From: Jennie Campbell <jennie.campbell@viserion.co>
Sent: Tuesday, December 2, 2025 17:37
To: Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: dashboard freight matrix

 

Hi,

 

I wanted to look at soybean freight from USG to China via cape vs panama canal. The matrix chart won't let me select two to see on the same graph together, so I tried to download both to put them together on one chart myself. But when I download, it only gives me 1 point of data (I tried both export as underlying data and summarized data and they both only give one point). When I open excel it looks like the second snapshot. 

Unless it's an immediate fix, can you go and send me the data first please?

 

       

 

 

 

 

Thanks,

Jennie

 

 

 

Jennie Campbell

Viserion Management Company

914-860-5692

Hi,

I wanted to look at soybean freight from USG to China via cape vs panama canal. The matrix chart won't let me select two to see on the same graph together, so I tried to download both to put them together on one chart myself. But when I download, it only gives me 1 point of data (I tried both export as underlying data and summarized data and they both only give one point).
